info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 3:35PM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Gusty winds are expected to begin 18 to 24 hours before the snow begins. Snow is likely to begin between 10 AM PST and 4 PM PST Monday. For the Winter Storm Warning, high winds, snow, and blowing snow expected. Total new snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Wind gusts 55 to 75 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, gusty winds, snow, and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting 35 to 55 mph. * WHERE... - For the Winter Storm Warning: Winter Rim, the Warner Mountains, Highways 395 and 31 from Valley Falls northward, Highway 97 east of Lakeview, and Highway 299 over the Warner Mountains. - For the Winter Weather Advisory: The Silver Lake and Fort Rock areas in northern Lake County and much of the remainder of Modoc County. * WHEN...From 4 PM Sunday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, at times, in the warning area. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to near whiteout conditions, at times, especially in areas prone to strong southerly winds. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes Monday into early Tuesday. Gusty winds could also bring down tree branches possibly leading to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds are expected to begin 18 to 24 hours before the snow begins. Snow is likely to begin between 10 AM PST and 4 PM PST Monday. The heaviest snow is most likely to occur Monday afternoon into Monday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
